comment.author: 63051299@N00
comment._content:
Having been here earlier this year, I'm finding it hard to get any sense of perspective as to specifically where this photo was taken.. It's almost unrecognisable to it's current state (unless I'm trying to picture the wrong thing!)

Still, great image. Would've been amazing to have 'discovered' this..

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: 18th dynasty of the New Kingdom, 1473-1458 B.C. - Mortuary Temple of Queen Pharoh Hathshepsut, at Deir El Bahari (Deir El Bahri ) pre-excavation state -  great lower entrance ramp seen center left - architecture attributed to Senemut (Senmut) - image probably taken up hill from right flank.  Archeologist Howard Carter is noted as having been employed as an artist, in the1890s working for the Egyptian Exploration Fund to explore this site.

comment.author: 25752562@N07
comment._content: This is the mortuary temple of Mentuhotep, which lies immediately south of the mortuary temple of Hatshepsut.
